meanings.definition: Clothing or garments worn on the body.
meanings.sent1: She carefully selected her vestures for the party.
meanings.sent2: The queen's elegant vestures dazzled the crowd.
meanings.sent3: The talking dog wore human vestures and caused quite a stir.
meanings.sent4: His kindness was his most precious vesture.
meanings.sent5: The knight's vesture gleamed in the sunlight as he rode into battle.

meanings.definition: To clothe or dress in garments.
meanings.sent1: The stylist will vesture the model in the latest fashion trends.
meanings.sent2: Parents vesture their newborns in soft blankets to keep them warm.
meanings.sent3: The magician vestured the rabbit in a tiny top hat and cape.
meanings.sent4: Music vesture the soul in emotions words cannot express.
meanings.sent5: The artist vesture her canvas in vibrant colors, bringing it to life.
